SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.exceptions.handler

Class DefaultGlobalExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.exceptions.handler.DefaultGlobalExceptionHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
GlobalExceptionHandler
public final class DefaultGlobalExceptionHandler extends Object implements GlobalExceptionHandler
Provides a default mechanism for handling exceptions in a Jolt-based application.

This handler inspects the thrown exception, determines an appropriate HTTP status code, and sends an error response using HttpServletResponse.sendError(int, String). If the exception is a JoltHttpException, its HttpStatus is used; otherwise, it defaults to HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR.

Annotated with JoltConfiguration as the default exception handler. Applications can define their own global exception handler by implementing GlobalExceptionHandler and overriding the default via @JoltConfiguration(value = ConfigurationType.EXCEPTION_HANDLER).

Since:
1.0
Author:
William

  • Method Details

    • handle

      public void handle(Throwable t, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
      Handles a thrown Throwable by sending an HTTP error response.

      If the exception is a JoltHttpException, the corresponding HttpStatus is used. Otherwise, the status defaults to HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR. The exception's message is included in the response unless it is blank, in which case the HttpStatus reason is used.

      Specified by:
      handle in interface GlobalExceptionHandler
      Parameters:
      t - The thrown Throwable to handle
      res - The HttpServletResponse in which the error is written
